text:
A project A runs fine when run directly.  But when it's run via an 'ant' task 
from project B, a task defined w/ a taskdef in project A doesn't work because 
the classpath for the task is not set correctly or not set at all..
creator: ian_springer@hp.com

text:
Can you please provide more information, possibly a testcase. 

I'd like to see the taskdefs, know where the classes that implement the task are
located, the basedirs for the two projects, a -debug trace, etc.
creator: conor@apache.org

text:
I wasn't able to create a very simple test case that duplicates the behavior.  
I can send you the original 2 build.xml's if that would be helpful.  However, 
I won't be able to send all the dependencies, since they are huge and mostly 
proprietary.
creator: ian_springer@hp.com

text:
I can only reproduce this when the classpath I set has a bad pointer to the jar 
file that contains the task. Are you sure that's not the case in your 
situation? If you can pick up Ant1.5Beta1 and run it -debug, you can look for 
output that says "dropping <jar_file> from path as it doesn't exist". (With 
1.4.1, the best you'd be able to see is the "Finding <classname>" just after 
the "+Task: taskdef".)
